item.title: AI-powered robots begin manufacturing cars in bid to raise automation efficiency
item.description: Artificial intelligence is enhancing industrial robots, making manufacturing more efficient and safer. Automakers are leading this trend, with significant advancements in robotics research at institutions like MIT and companies like Toyota. The shift to electric vehicles is also providing new opportunities for increased productivity using the latest robotic technology.

item.title: Hybrids compromise green mobility
item.description: As one industry observer puts it, “The façade of hybrids being green is a ruse; they are primarily fossil fuel vehicles dressed in electric clothing. When it comes to achieving zero emissions, only full electric vehicles can deliver.”

item.title: Waymo in talks with Hyundai Motor to produce self-driving taxis
item.description: Officials at Waymo and Hyundai Motor have met more than three times to discuss a plan to use Hyundai's Ioniq 5 electric vehicles for Waymo's sixth-generation self-driving technology, the report said, adding that the vehicles would replace the offerings from China's Zeekr, which Waymo is currently testing.

item.title: ZF secures long-term deal with Ford Trucks to power electric heavy vehicles
item.description: ZF’s Commercial Vehicle Solutions division has secured a long-term agreement with Ford Trucks to supply e-mobility technologies for their upcoming electrified heavy trucks. This partnership highlights ZF's leading position in Europe for electric commercial drives and supports Ford Trucks' mission to develop sustainable transport solutions.

item.title: Tata, Analog Devices to explore opportunities for semiconductor manufacturing in India
item.description: "Tata Electronics, Tata Motors and Tejas Networks signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with ADI to enhance strategic and business cooperation, explore opportunities for semiconductor manufacturing in India, and use ADI's products in Tata applications like electric vehicles and network infrastructure," the statement said.

item.title: India, US for giving push to sustainable aviation fuel, hydrogen in buses
item.description: "While recognising the need to work towards a just, orderly and sustainable energy transition, which prioritises access to reliable, affordable, and clean energy supplies, the (two) sides welcomed the important role that energy trade plays in supporting the national priorities of both countries," the statement said.

item.title: Drive System Design showcases innovative electrified propulsion systems at IAA Transportation 2024
item.description: Drive System Design (DSD), acquired by Hinduja Tech in 2022, will showcase its latest electrified propulsion systems at IAA Transportation 2024 in Hannover. DSD's expertise spans systems integration, performance enhancement, and development testing, offering innovative solutions for electric, hybrid, and conventional powertrains.

item.title: Drivers more likely to be distracted while using partial automation tech, study shows
item.description: Insurance Institute for Highway Safety (IIHS) conducted month-long studies with two such systems - Tesla's Autopilot and Volvo's Pilot Assist - to examine driver behavior when the technology was in use and how it evolved over time.

item.title: Renesas expands R&D in India, eyes growth in automotive and IoT sectors
item.description: In an effort to improve its skills in India, Renesas is also actively collaborating with local partners. It recently established an outsourced semiconductor assembly and test (OSAT) partnership with CG Power, which is a step toward strengthening the local supply chain.

item.title: Bosch targets India and China for hydrogen engine powertrain in commercial vehicles
item.description: India and China both have a great potential to utilise this new green hydrogen powertrain technology. In India ample green hydrogen is available that can boost this new technology, believes Andreas Dempf, Head of sales and customers for the Mobility Solutions business sector, Bosch. Hydrogen engine technology provides an opportunity to reuse the existing components, aiding in cost reduction of the components used in the vehicles making it more accessible.

item.title: Hinduja Group entity issues high yield bonds to partly fund Reliance Cap buy
item.description: The company invited bids from investors earlier in the day and received bids from high-net-worth investors, family offices and domestic private credit funds, the bankers said requesting anonymity as they are not authorised to talk to the media.

item.title: Sterlite copper unveils LNG vehicles to achieve net zero carbon emissions
item.description: Sterlite Copper has launched LNG vehicles at Vedanta's Copper Plant in Silvassa, partnering with Green Line Mobility Solutions. This initiative aims to reduce carbon emissions and promote sustainability. The LNG trucks will replace diesel trucks for transporting goods, contributing to a significant reduction in CO2 emissions by 2025.

item.title: Samvardhana Motherson to invest USD 15 mn for 11% stake in auto tech major REE Automotive
item.description: Through this acquisition, “SAMIL can leverage manufacturing capabilities for components and integration for ‘REEcorner’ module, and platform assembly to support full vehicle assembly, including assembly of P7 electric trucks in the USA. Reinforcing tier-0.5 status,” stated SAMIL’s exchange filings.

item.title: SUN Mobility to raise funds for its new HEV biz; plans to commercialise in FY26
item.description: For its new HEV business, SUN Mobility targets fundraising to accelerate R&D (Research and development) and product manufacturing. “We're looking at raising further capital for our business in India….. in this quarter we're starting the process,” said Chetan Maini, co-founder and chairman of SUN Mobility to ETAuto.

item.title: Lumax Auto Technologies acquires majority stake in Greenfuel Energy Solutions to enter green fuels market
item.description: Lumax Auto Technologies Limited is set to enter the green and alternate fuels segment by acquiring a majority stake in Greenfuel Energy Solutions. This strategic move aims to expand Lumax's offerings in CNG, hydrogen, and other applications, positioning them as leaders in the growing alternate fuels market.

item.title: Govt assures data privacy with satellite-based tolling
item.description: Sources said understanding the complexity of protecting data privacy, the scheme will first bring the commercial vehicles under this regime. “Detailed studies are being conducted on how to deal with this and how other countries have dealt with private vehicles. This may need actual testing to see and ensure that private data is not exposed,” said an official.

item.title: Bali launches app to attract public interest in EV
item.description: Head of the Bali Transportation Agency, I Gde Wayan Samsi Gunarta, stated on Friday that the reluctance to adopt electric vehicles (EVs) persists among many people due to concerns over insufficient distance capacity and the fear of battery depletion during travel.

item.title: Betting on lead acid battery tech still, Amara Raja Batteries plans inorganic move overseas
item.description: The Hyderabad based battery major looks to expand its manufacturing footprint beyond the borders as it sees lead acid battery demand to remain healthy for the near future. Plans part of the group’s strategy to touch the USD 6 billion mark by 2029.

item.title: ZF Lifetec opens GCC in Hyderabad with EUR 5 million investment; looks to expand global R&D footprint
item.description: ZF Lifetec has opened a new Global Capability Center in Hyderabad, investing 5 million euros to advance passive safety technology. The facility aims to enhance road safety in India and globally, employing around 220 professionals with plans for future expansion. The Telangana government supports this initiative.

item.title: Affordable air taxis will soon be a reality, says Modi
item.description: PM Modi announced that affordable air taxis will soon be available in India, highlighting the transformation of the aviation sector over the past decade. Speaking at the Asia Pacific ministerial conference of civil aviation, he emphasized technological innovations and a trained workforce as key factors for continued growth. The conference concluded with the passing of the 'Delhi Declaration.'
